<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 16"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Lead the Pack](/Feats.aspx?ID=1909) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 161 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetypes** [Beastmaster](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=50), [Undead Master](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=176) (Level 16)

**Prerequisites**
[Mature Beastmaster Companion](/Feats.aspx?ID=1903); you have multiple animal companions

</column>

---

You can have up to two animal companions active at once. However, when you do, it's slightly more difficult to [Command](/Actions.aspx?ID=58) them. If you don't Command either of your companions, one of the two (your choice) can still use 1 action on your turn to Stride or Strike, as per [Mature Beastmaster Companion](/Feats.aspx?ID=1903), but not both. When you Command an Animal, either choose one of the companions to take 2 actions, as normal, or else both companions can take 1 action to Stride or Strike. Either way, you can't Command an Animal to make either companion act again until your next turn.
name: Lead the Pack
prerequisite: Mature Beastmaster Companion; you have multiple animal companions
